001package io.jstach.kiwi.kvs;
002
003import java.net.URI;
004import java.util.Optional;
005import java.util.function.BiConsumer;
006
007import io.jstach.kiwi.kvs.KeyValuesServiceProvider.KeyValuesLoaderFinder.LoaderContext;
008import io.jstach.kiwi.kvs.KeyValuesServiceProvider.KeyValuesMediaFinder;
009import io.jstach.kiwi.kvs.Variables.Parameters;
010
011/**
012 * A service provider interface (SPI) for extending Kiwi's capabilities to support
013 * additional media types and URI patterns. Implementations of this interface can be
014 * loaded using {@link java.util.ServiceLoader}.
015 *
016 * <p>
017 * This SPI allows customization and extension of Kiwi's loading mechanisms and media type
018 * parsing.
019 *
020 * <p>
021 * Note: This interface is sealed, and any sub-interface implementations must be
022 * registered using {@code provides KeyValuesServiceProvider with ...} in the
023 * {@code module-info.java} or as entries in the
024 * {@code META-INF/services/io.jstach.kiwi.kvs.KeyValuesServiceProvider} file.
025 * Sub-interfaces such as {@link KeyValuesLoaderFinder} and {@link KeyValuesMediaFinder}
026 * should <strong>not</strong> be directly referenced in the service registration.
027 *
028 * <p>
029 * Example use cases include adding support for custom media types or integrating
030 * specialized URI loading logic.
031 */
032public sealed interface KeyValuesServiceProvider {
033
034        /**
035         * A service provider interface for finding {@link KeyValuesLoader} implementations
036         * that can handle specific {@link KeyValuesResource} instances.
037         */
038        public non-sealed interface KeyValuesLoaderFinder extends KeyValuesServiceProvider {
039
040                /**
041                 * A context provided to {@link KeyValuesLoaderFinder} implementations to supply
042                 * necessary dependencies and services for creating a {@link KeyValuesLoader}.
043                 */
044                public sealed interface LoaderContext {
045
046                        /**
047                         * Retrieves the {@link KeyValuesEnvironment} for accessing system-level
048                         * resources and properties.
049                         * @return the environment instance
050                         */
051                        KeyValuesEnvironment environment();
052
053                        /**
054                         * Retrieves the {@link KeyValuesMediaFinder} for finding media types.
055                         * @return the media finder instance
056                         */
057                        KeyValuesMediaFinder mediaFinder();
058
059                        /**
060                         * Retrieves the {@link Variables} used for interpolation.
061                         * @return the variables instance
062                         */
063                        Variables variables();
064
065                        /**
066                         * Finds and returns a required parser for the specified
067                         * {@link KeyValuesResource}. Throws an exception if no parser is found.
068                         * @param resource the resource for which to find a parser
069                         * @return the parser for the resource
070                         * @throws KeyValuesMediaException if no parser is found for the resource's
071                         * media type
072                         */
073                        default KeyValuesMedia.Parser requireParser(KeyValuesResource resource) {
074                                return mediaFinder() //
075                                        .findByResource(resource) //
076                                        .orElseThrow(() -> new KeyValuesMediaException("Media Type not found. resource: " + resource))
077                                        .parser();
078                        }
079
080                        /**
081                         * Formats a {@link KeyValuesResource} into its key-value representation and
082                         * applies it to a given consumer. This method allows serializing the resource
083                         * into key-value pairs.
084                         * @param resource the resource to format
085                         * @param consumer the consumer to apply the formatted key-value pairs
086                         */
087                        void formatResource(KeyValuesResource resource, BiConsumer<String, String> consumer);
088
089                        /**
090                         * Formats a resource parameter key how it is represented as key in the parsed
091                         * resource.
092                         * @param resource resource to base the full parameter name on.
093                         * @param parameterName the short parameter from
094                         * {@link KeyValuesResource#parameters()}.
095                         * @return FQ parameter name.
096                         */
097                        String formatParameterKey(KeyValuesResource resource, String parameterName);
098
099                }
100
101                /**
102                 * Finds a {@link KeyValuesLoader} capable of loading the specified
103                 * {@link KeyValuesResource} using the provided {@link LoaderContext}.
104                 * @param context the context containing dependencies and services
105                 * @param resource the resource for which a loader is sought
106                 * @return an {@link Optional} containing the loader if found, or empty if not
107                 */
108                public Optional<? extends KeyValuesLoader> findLoader(LoaderContext context, KeyValuesResource resource);
109
110        }
111
112        /**
113         * A service provider interface (SPI) for filtering key values after a resource is
114         * loaded.
115         *
116         * <p>
117         * Filters are applied to modify, rename, or remove key-value pairs without altering
118         * the original resource. This can be useful for transforming keys to a desired format
119         * or eliminating unnecessary entries before the key values are processed further.
120         *
121         * <h2>Usage</h2>
122         * <p>
123         * A {@code KeyValuesFilter} is invoked after a {@link KeyValuesResource} is loaded
124         * but before the resulting {@link KeyValues} are passed to the next stage of
125         * processing. The filter uses a filter name and optional parameters to determine how
126         * the key values should be modified.
127         * </p>
128         *
129         * Filters are enabled by using the {@link KeyValuesResource#KEY_FILTER} key where the
130         * default syntax is <code>_filter_[resourceName]_[filterId]=expression</code>.
131         *
132         * <h2>Builtin Filters</h2>
133         *
134         * <h3><code>grep</code></h3>
135         *
136         * Grep will filter keys by a regular expression. If the expression matches any part
137         * of the key the key value is included.
138         *
139         * {@snippet lang = properties :
140         *
141         * _load_resource=...
142         * _filter_resource_grep=someregex
143         *
144         * }
145         *
146         * <h3><code>sed</code></h3>
147         *
148         * Sed can change the keys name with subsitution or drop keys altogether. It follows a
149         * subset of the UNIX sed command where "<code>s</code>" and "<code>d</code>" are
150         * supported commands.
151         *
152         * {@snippet lang = properties :
153         *
154         * _load_resource=...
155         * _filter_resource_sed=/match/ s/replace/withme/g
156         *
157         * }
158         *
159         * <h2>Extensibility</h2>
160         * <p>
161         * Implementations of {@code KeyValuesFilter} can be registered using the
162         * {@code provides} directive in {@code module-info.java} or the
163         * {@code META-INF/services} mechanism with the fully qualified name of
164         * {@link KeyValuesServiceProvider}. <strong>Ideally the filter only applies filtering
165         * based on the passed in filter name.</strong> Otherwise it should just return the
166         * passed in key values.
167         * </p>
168         *
169         * <p>
170         * For example, to provide a custom implementation:
171         * </p>
172         * <pre>{@code
173         * module my.module {
174         *     provides io.jstach.kiwi.kvs.KeyValuesServiceProvider with my.module.MyKeyValuesFilter;
175         * }
176         * }</pre>
177         *
178         * <h2>Method Details</h2>
179         *
180         * <p>
181         * The {@link #filter(FilterContext, KeyValues, Filter)} method performs the filtering
182         * operation.
183         * </p>
184         */
185        public non-sealed interface KeyValuesFilter extends KeyValuesServiceProvider {
186
187                /**
188                 * Provides contextual information to a filter, including the environment and any
189                 * parameters specified for the filtering operation.
190                 *
191                 * @param environment the environment used to access system-level properties and
192                 * resources
193                 * @param parameters the parameters associated with the filtering operation
194                 */
195                public record FilterContext(KeyValuesEnvironment environment, Parameters parameters) {
196                }
197
198                /**
199                 * A filter description with filter identifier and expression which is the DSL
200                 * code that the filter will parse use to do filtering.
201                 *
202                 * @param filter filter identifier.
203                 * @param expression string code used by the filter to determine filtering.
204                 * @param name used to differentiate multiple calls to the same filter type when
205                 * looking up parameters. Defaults to empty string.
206                 */
207                public record Filter(String filter, String expression, String name) {
208
209                }
210
211                /**
212                 * Applies a filter to the given key-value pairs. The filter should ideally only
213                 * be applied if the passed filter parameter matches (filter name) otherwise the
214                 * filter just return the passed in key values.
215                 * @param context the filter context providing the environment and parameters
216                 * @param keyValues the key-value pairs to be filtered
217                 * @param filter filter description
218                 * @return a new {@link KeyValues} instance with the filtered key-value pairs
219                 */
220                KeyValues filter(FilterContext context, KeyValues keyValues, Filter filter);
221
222        }
223
224        /**
225         * A service provider interface for finding {@link KeyValuesMedia} implementations
226         * based on various attributes such as file extensions, media types, and URIs.
227         */
228        public non-sealed interface KeyValuesMediaFinder extends KeyValuesServiceProvider {
229
230                /**
231                 * Finds a {@link KeyValuesMedia} based on the attributes of a given
232                 * {@link KeyValuesResource}.
233                 * @param resource the resource for which to find the media type
234                 * @return an {@link Optional} containing the media if found, or empty if not
235                 */
236                default Optional<KeyValuesMedia> findByResource(KeyValuesResource resource) {
237                        String mediaType = resource.mediaType();
238                        if (mediaType == null) {
239                                return findByUri(resource.uri());
240                        }
241                        return findByMediaType(mediaType);
242                }
243
244                /**
245                 * Finds a {@link KeyValuesMedia} based on a file extension.
246                 * @param ext the file extension (e.g., "properties")
247                 * @return an {@link Optional} containing the media if found, or empty if not
248                 */
249                public Optional<KeyValuesMedia> findByExt(String ext);
250
251                /**
252                 * Finds a {@link KeyValuesMedia} based on a media type string.
253                 * @param mediaType the media type (e.g., "application/json")
254                 * @return an {@link Optional} containing the media if found, or empty if not
255                 */
256                public Optional<KeyValuesMedia> findByMediaType(String mediaType);
257
258                /**
259                 * Finds a {@link KeyValuesMedia} based on a {@link URI}.
260                 * @param uri the URI to analyze
261                 * @return an {@link Optional} containing the media if found, or empty if not
262                 */
263                public Optional<KeyValuesMedia> findByUri(URI uri);
264
265        }
266
267}
268
269record DefaultLoaderContext(KeyValuesEnvironment environment, KeyValuesMediaFinder mediaFinder, Variables variables,
270                KeyValuesResourceParser resourceParser) implements LoaderContext {
271        static LoaderContext of(KeyValuesSystem system, Variables variables, KeyValuesResourceParser resourceParser) {
272                return new DefaultLoaderContext(system.environment(), system.mediaFinder(), variables, resourceParser);
273        }
274
275        @Override
276        public void formatResource(KeyValuesResource resource, BiConsumer<String, String> consumer) {
277                resourceParser.formatResource(resource, consumer);
278        }
279
280        @Override
281        public String formatParameterKey(KeyValuesResource resource, String parameterName) {
282                return resourceParser.formatParameterKey(resource, parameterName);
283        }
284
285}
